snippet: A meeting in Turkey near Syria’s northern border spoke volumes about the priorities of Syrian fighting groups, which are focused on the basics of war against President Bashar al-Assad.
abstract: Meeting of Syrian rebel commanders says much about the priorities of the opposition fighting groups at this stage of the conflict; anti-Assad groups complain that as they have added members, they are competing for resources; there is also frustration with exiled Syrians who claim leadership positions but are either diverting funds or playing favorites in funneling weapons and money into the country.

byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad contributed reporting from Antakya, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: A meeting in Turkey near Syria’s northern border spoke volumes about the priorities of Syrian fighting groups, which are focused on the basics of war against President Bashar al-Assad.

headline.seo: Commanders of Syrian Rebels Unite in Frustration
headline.main: Fresh From Syria, Rebel Commanders Unite in Frustration
headline.print_headline: Fresh From Syria, Commanders Of Rebels Unite in Frustration
